caption:
In this photograph, an elderly man is smiling warmly at the camera, exuding a cheerful and inviting demeanor. He is dressed in a style typical of a cowboy, featuring a brown cowboy hat adorned with a decorative feather on the left side, and he wears round, wire-framed sunglasses. The man is wearing a plaid shirt with tones of red, yellow, and black, further reinforcing the rustic, Western theme.

The shirt is neatly tucked into his pants, belted with a simple black leather belt, featuring a modest buckle. It seems he's also sporting a wristwatch on his left wrist, obscured partially by his shirtsleeve.

The setting appears to be outdoors in a rural or natural area, with a blurry background suggesting a green, rolling landscape that might be a grassy field or a gentle hill. The lighting is bright and natural, indicating it might be midday, which casts a clear light on the man and highlights his cheerful expression and the textures of his apparel.

The overall mood of the photo is jovial and pleasant, capturing a moment of genuine happiness and comfort in a natural setting. This portrait not only focuses on the man's joyful expression but also subtly tells a story of his lifestyle or heritage through his attire and the surrounding environment.
title: Bud Redding is one of the Sarpy Basin ranchers who is resisting the Westmoreland Coal Company's attempts to buy their land for strip mining. Sarpy Basin is part of some 25,000 square miles in Montana and Wyoming with rich seams of sub-bituminous coal.
